description: This Kotlin source file defines the FolderNotesActivity class, which is an Android activity responsible for displaying notes within a specific folder. It manages user interactions, data loading via the NotesRepository, and UI updates, including note listing, loading indicators, and contextual menus.

classes.name: FolderNotesActivity
classes.description: An Android activity that displays a list of notes belonging to a specified folder, allowing for interaction such as pinning, favoriting, deleting, and opening notes.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the activity, sets up the UI components, and retrieves intent extras to determine which folder's notes to display.

methods.name: onResume
methods.description: Refreshes the data shown when the activity is resumed.

methods.name: loadData
methods.description: Loads notes associated with the specified folder from the repository and updates the UI accordingly.

methods.name: showLoading
methods.description: Shows or hides the loading indicator based on a boolean parameter.

methods.name: onSupportNavigateUp
methods.description: Handles navigation when the Up button is pressed, typically finishing the activity.

methods.name: onNoteClicked
methods.description: Handles the event when a note item is clicked, opening the note in the editor.

methods.name: onNoteMenuClicked
methods.description: Displays a popup menu with options (pin/unpin, favorite/unfavorite, delete) for a specific note and handles user selection.

methods.name: newIntent
methods.description: Creates an intent to start FolderNotesActivity with specified folder ID and name.
